pull.title: Modify command line help to show support for BIP21 URIs
pull.body:
While reviewing a different PR (see https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/742 ) @hebasto suggested that the help for bitcoin-qt should be updated to reflect the fact that bitcoin-qt supports an optional BIP21 URI parameter.

Since this reflects actual behaviour of bitcoin-qt and is independent of whether or not the other PR gets merged, I created this simple PR to fix the help message.

issue.title: getrawtransaction implementation
issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/645.

Add `getrawtransaction` RPC to GUI on `Tools -> Verify external txid.` tab

[Screencast from 21-12-2023 06:35:04 ASUBUHI.webm](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/assets/15610188/00124a6e-5a16-48b4-b956-6682b7144415)

events.message: Modify command line help to show support for BIP21 URIs

events.body: Fixed the 2 typos mentioned by @luke-jr and @kristapsk . Also rebased for CI.

comments.body: What is the purpose of these extra spaces on the end? Do they need to be adjusted? Can't seem to figure it out from the git history either :/
Probably better to just leave it as `[URI]` here, and if BIP21 is mentioned, only do so in the explanation below.

I think it can be removed, it doesn't make any difference. I couldn't find any other reference in the code of such a thing (extra spaces at the end of a line before an \n). I think it was some formatting logic left behind.

Regarding its historical origins, it seems that it was coming from the `bitcoind`/ `bitcoin-cli` helps and copied over ([#13872](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13872)).
You can still see it at some places (exactly the same 22 spaces):
![image](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/assets/110166421/0fbe1cf6-2d6b-4690-b1f2-e393f5bda0ec)

Why not the [complete syntax representation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0021.mediawiki#user-content-ABNF_grammar) of the BIP21 command?
```
 bitcoinurn     = "bitcoin:" bitcoinaddress [ "?" bitcoinparams ]
 bitcoinaddress = *base58
 bitcoinparams  = bitcoinparam [ "&" bitcoinparams ]
 bitcoinparam   = [ amountparam / labelparam / messageparam / otherparam / reqparam ]
 amountparam    = "amount=" *digit [ "." *digit ]
 labelparam     = "label=" *qchar
 messageparam   = "message=" *qchar
 otherparam     = qchar *qchar [ "=" *qchar ]
 reqparam       = "req-" qchar *qchar [ "=" *qchar ]

```

Also, I'd remove 1 space after "Usage:", so the start of "bitcoind" matches the alignment of the options helps.
```suggestion
        QString header = "Usage: bitcoin-qt [command-line options] [BIP21 URI]                     \n\n"
```
@pablomartin4btc I think this is not the place to explain BIP21, and I'll follow @luke-jr 's advice on this one.

I agree with @luke-jr and @pablomartin4btc , I ll remove the extra spaces at the end, I see no reason to leave them. Regarding the help2man tool mentioned in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13872 , there is no reason for extra spaces.

Square brackets mean that URI option is optional. Either use "[URI]" or "Optional URI" below, not "Optional [URI]".
```suggestion
                         "Optional URI is a bitcoin address in BIP21 URI format.\n";
```
